answers.answer: HiThanks for writing to the forum!Ketones and proteins in the urine can result from many factors, like excessive exercise, dehydration, high protein diet, kidney problems, and diabetes. Diabetes in the initial stages does not produce glucose in urine. However neither will it bring about ketones and proteins in the urine at an early stage. These are generally the signs of uncontrolled diabetes. You need to check the blood sugar fasting (8-12 hours) and two hours after a proper meal.Maybe you should explore other causes—like dieting, drinking less water during the day, exercising a lot, eating a high protein diet. If none of these are true for you, then you must insist on a blood glucose examination and maybe a glucose challenge test. It could be either diabetes or high insulin that is causing problems. Another possibility is thyroid problems.Hope this helps. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

Hi,Thanks for the post. I thought I should tell you, I do not like meat, or peanut butter, so I do not eat it a lot.  I also drink a lot of juice and water.  Not that much water.  My doctor told me to drink gatorade.  I also do not do much exercising (more like none), and I have never dieted.  Before I had the test, I had a large lunch.  Thanks for your help.

question: Hi, I am a sixteen year old girl, 5'4 and weigh in the high 90's.  I am unsure about what I have, but I can tell you that when I tested my blood sugar, after fasting (14 hours), it was about 124, but then I realized the test strips were expired. I went to the doctor and the found a high amount of protein in my urine, and also ketones, but no sugar in. (I was tested about two hours after a large meal too, so the ketones were not out of starvation, and I do not exercise.) They have always seen protein in my urine also. At times though, I can tell my blood sugar goes down a lot, because I get very shaky, and at other times when my blood sugar is not low, I sometime black out for a second, get very dizzy, and faint.  I also have excessive night sweats, and minor inner ear pain.  I am not sure what to think any more. Any help would be great!P.S: We just found out I am also lactose intolerant.
title: Could I have diabetes?
